description: these 6 little dishes with 2-4 pieces of sushi each, costed $22.70, and with tax (as if the sushi wasn't expensive enough) it costed $24.64 (exact ik) then with a bit of tips costed around $30. if we do a little bit of estimating and math(ing) 1 sushi costs $1 (about, hence "estimating") pretty decent sushi, not good nor bad, but for the price i would say not worth it, would not buy again. only for the rich.  2 stars.
author: Banana S.

description:
Last time I go to a restaurant without checking Yelp first... shame on me!

I met a friend from out of town and, as we were nearby and starving, and the cute sushi boat bar had a couple seats available, we decided to stop in.

As we were hungry, it was nice for us to be able to pick up some things off the conveyor belt right away. The seaweed salad was fine, and the sushi we picked were OK. However, the rice seemed a bit stale and the fish not so fresh. We decided to order edamame off the menu, which came out quickly, but was cold. 

Before we left, I started feeling like something wasn't sitting right with me. By the end of the night, I had a terrible stomach ache.

Would not recommend!
author: Roya B.

description: Amazing sushi bowls and fresh watermelon juice! My friends and I went here after visiting stores in SF Chinatown. The prices are cheap by SF standards. I think most of the negative reviews are from finicky tourists who don't understand that most places in SF are 2X the price and not in the heart of Chinatown.
author: Nick L.

description: My family and I wanted a quick bite to eat before heading out of SF Chinatown so we took a chance on this place. The service was very weird, the staff was disorganized and on some of the tables there was watermelon everywhere! Their initial introduction was quite cool because instead of a conveyor belt that other sushi places have, this place had the sushi on plates that were on top of wooden boats, floating on water around the chef. The novelty of the floating boats wears off pretty fast, when you start looking at pricing. The price of each dish depends on the design on the plate, ranging from about $1.95-$5.95. I would understand that price for maybe half a roll, but the plates are for 2 PIECES of sushi! And the sushi was okay, nothing special at all. Definitely would not recommend coming here.
author: Grace D.

description: Eww! Old and stale. I don't recommend any of the raw fish either. Lesson learned to try Japanese food in Chinatown.
author: Gerald H.

description: The food was bad. The chicken bento box was oily. The rice was not enough for me, and I'm only 5'5 and 95 pounds. The soup tasted like hot water with too much salt. This restaurant was overpriced with terrible service. To be polite, we still gave the waiter ten percent of tips. He was not happy about that because his face clearly showed that. DO NOT recommend this restaurant at all to anyone.
author: Emma W.

description: Zero stars. This restaurant closed and has reopened. Thinking that the restaurant changed ownership and staff, I decided to try it, which ended up to be a very bad idea. It was sooooo terrible. The beef teriyaki they used is exactly like the beef chow fun beef wth. The ca roll was soggy and nasty; rice was squishy and bland. I didn't even finish, took a couple of bites, paid and left. Literally spent double, had to get more edible food elsewhere. This is a tourist establishment, beware.
author: L C.

description: Went in this restaurant asking if my daughter can use their restroom. They said they charge $1.00... with an attitude. We paid $1.00 so my 12 yr daughter can use the restroom.  This is ridiculous. Talking about customer service... None at this restaurant. I will never dine here.
author: Kattie O.

description: We had to wait around 15 mins and it was clear they were unstaffed. The waitress wiped the table with a dirty rag that smelled like piss..it was so disgusting. We ate like 4 plates to see how the quality was not worth the price. I would not recommend this dirty place. Also the old Asian lady that accepts the money in front is very rude.
author: Wing-Yu S.

description:
Omg! This place is outrageously EXPENSIVE! I honestly wouldn't mind paying whatever the price was, if the sushi was amazingly delicious. But honestly, I think the ones that they have at the grocery is just as good as these, and that's not even saying much. 

Went we first got in, no one really pointed us in the right direction. We were starving at this point, and we happen to see openings at the bar, so we decided to sit there. We've been to a sushi place like this, where you just pull whatever sushi you want, and pay per plate. We didn't see how much the plates were until we asked. The lady pointed at this picture thing where it showed 5 different plates, at 5 different prices. 

The sashimi that I got was $6! WTHECK!?!? And there was only 2 of them. Like I said before, I don't mind paying for quality, but you could tell this one was not fresh at all. The rice was super soggy and the salmon cut was warmer than room temperature. 

I didn't even bother to say anything or do anything about it at this point, just because the people who worked there ignored us from the beginning.
author: Joanna R.

description: Pricey and not satisfying. We only came in because we needed to use the restroom. We only ordered 3 dishes and it came out to be approx $18. Customer service was also so-so. I did like the sushi boats on the water conveyor belt which was different, but the food wasn't as good (and didn't look as good) to match the cool concept.
author: Wendy T.

description:
If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  Service was horrible and the employees were extremely rude. The ramen was terrible and tasted like sweat and was fishy.... I ordered the pork ramen...
They're very expensive... we were robbed! They charge an automatic 10% tip. Never again.
author: Ari K.

description: When we asked for refills the waitress told us no refills.  When I came down to paying the bill  I said no tip.  The chicken teriyaki  tasted like German Shepherd teriyaki.  I would be willing to bet $1000 it was not chicken.  The sashimi was OK as was the tempura.  The waitress was pretty rude apparently she doesn't understand how the tip system works.
author: Tony D.

description: Nice place to eat. Service ok. Floating boat idea does the trick. Sushi tastes good. Not very cheap. But you can control this yourself if you eat by place. Pricing 1.95 - 5.95 per plate.
author: Arjan V.

description:
The sushi was OK and there was something for the whole family. However, I saw a big food service violation that the employee I reported it to seemed totally unconcerned about.

One of the employees was sitting in the dining area, preparing bowls of pickled ginger and wasabi. The tray of bowls was in front of her and a bowl of soup was in the middle of the table. Every so often, she would bring the bowl towards herself and take a big slurp of soup, right over the bowls of ginger. When the sushi chef had a dish ready, she'd jump up, still chewing, to serve the meal. I was totally grossed out.
author: Laura F.

description:
This place has a cool looking concept but after seeing a fellow patron accidentally splash the water on a boat, had I known my way around china town, I would have tried somewhere else but I was hot, tired and hungry.  I opted to order from the menu for my own safety (Not a good thing to worry about in a sushi restaurant).  I got a Hot Tuna roll and a rice bowl with curry. Hard to mess it up, the food was freshly made but bland. 

The service was also questionable, I think they got everyone on my rows order out of place and they failed to offer me anything to drink when I sat down. 

My thoughts are that they have a good location, but should ditch the floating thing and just have a nice sushi and beer stand.
author: Marcy H.

description:
I'm going to blame this on being a tourist and having a very picky 12 year old deciding where to eat. A thousand years ago, I came here and had my very first sushi experience. Fast forward two decades or so later and here I am again, not looking for anything exquisite, just looking for a quick and easy place to eat after walking 34,935 miles. The kid orders won ton soup (oh dear lord) which came in a vat sized bowl. Her palate, which is that of someone with absolutely no taste buds, enjoyed it.  I got the watermelon juice ($3.95) and slurped it down immediately because I was thirsty. Then I picked the Japanese seaweed (I'm a sucker for it) and one roll which will remain nameless because I have no idea what I ate - just that these two little dishes floated by in front of me. My sister orders the pork belly yakitori. YES MAMA. At least one dish that was a bit out of the ordinary.

Come as tourists, leave as tourists.
author: Allie A.

description:
We tried the Daily special, which came with 
- Miso Soup
- California Roll
- Spicy Tuna Roll
- Edamame

The sushi was good

The floating conveyor belt sushi is a fascinating watch
author: Zeba S.

description: I really should had consider the fact that this place was empty on a busy day in Chinatown and the fact that it's a sushi restaurant in Chinatown. Never again! I just thought the floating sushi boat bar was cool, pretty expensive too for what it is though!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: This is probably one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had. The chicken tasted like a husky, the soup tasted like crap, and to top it all of no refills. Avoid this place, if you don't want to taste shit that is.
author: Justin D.

description:
Hole in The Wall

My sister and I spent the day in SF and stumbled upon this sushi place. Ugh, I so regret NOT checking the reviews before we went inside. 

First of all, we walked in and the floating boats had food on them that looked weeks old and not freshly made that day.

I went downstairs to go to the bathroom and there was buckets of food exposed RIGHT NEXT TO THE BATHROOM! Exposed too, not covered. The cleanliness of this place is so bad. So unsanitary.  This alone should condemn the place.

The customer service is horrible. We sat down, waited forever to get our water, which tasted like it was water from the bathroom toilet. 

We took our food from the sushi boats because I figured it would take forever to order something and we were starving and didn't want to wait. So overpriced. We grabbed the California rolls, each piece of a roll being a DOLLAR EACH!! For a California roll that looks like it's been sitting out for a week, that's pretty bad. 

I asked the waitress for edamame and it never came while we were sitting down. We waited about 20 minutes and just decided to go check out and leave. She saw us by the checkout counter, and ran and grabbed edamame and put it on our table. Then when we said we no longer wanted it because it took too long, she rolled her eyes and came forward to the checkout counter. Well, she tried to charge us for the edamame and then added a 10% tip??? When my sister and I said that we didn't think it was legal to do that without verbally disclosing that or even adding it on the menu, she said she can do whatever she wants and we had to pay it. We ended up paying $20 for two sushi rolls total that tasted bland and awful.  

WILL NEVER COME BACK HERE. BE WARNED. TERRIBLE IN EVERY WAY SHAPE AND FORM.
author: Hannah L.

description:
Its hard for me to believe this place is still in business. The service was the worst I have ever had in my entire life. We went in and looking to set next to the long floating table, and there are many seats open but not together. While we are trying to figure out how to manage to set together the waiter said its full over there and sit here! She throw the menu on the table. We were shocked but we set down. My mom took less than one min to use the bathroom and we decide to leave because we are not comfortable with the seating and service. The most amazing thing happened. The waiter almost chased us outside the door and shouting $3!,$3!. Bathroom 3 dollars. I can not believe my ear!
Honestly I think this waiter really want this place to be closed. I am serious.
author: Lina Y.

description:
I'm in San Francisco, first time ever in Chinatown... and I opt for sushi. Why? What I really wanted was some crispy, roasted pork belly, but I was so hungry and tired from walking up and down the hills that anything looked good and Floating Sushi Boat was it.

I'm a sushi ho. I can eat sushi all day, everyday, every night, for the rest of my life and never get tired of it. It's like water to me: essential to living a happy, healthy, and fulfilled life. There were so many good-looking Chinese restaurants around, but my coworkers and I decided on Floating Sushi Boat because of how excited I was walking by it. Thinking back, it was probably the best choice since the majority of my coworkers have very limited palates and are extremely picky eaters.

The woman who sat us was a little abrasive. She probably wasn't too happy about us making a bee-line for the sushi bar, but that's what we wanted... or so I thought. Honestly, I was the only person who ate entirely from the bar (two workers got rice bowls). I have no idea what I ate besides the seaweed salad and a California roll, but it was all so good! I was worried about a roll having shrimp and real crab in it (allergic), so I asked the chef and he made me one without. It was hot and crunchy and just too good. I had to ask for another one.

All that damn walking make me so thirsty, so I was gulping down water like crazy. Made my way down to the bathroom that was in the basement... where all of the cooking goes down. It's like a completely different continent down there! I definitely felt like I didn't belong. The bathroom wasn't as clean as it could have been, but it's not like I was eating in there or anything.

My bill came to about $21 which isn't bad for 6 plates of sushi and a plate of seaweed salad. I'm a little surprised by the reviews. Lost of Yelpers saying they wish they could zero-star reviews. I didn't think the place was THAT bad, but definitely needed some improvement. I would totally visit Floating Sushi Boat again if I'm ever in the area... after trying the other restaurants in the area, of course.
author: Urs M.

description:
Over priced and disappointing.
I got a crave for sushi when I was in Chinatown so I checked this place out. 
I order a small hot sake first. It was warm not hot. It's cost $7. Then I got a tempura roll plate of the conveyer belt.  I can't tell you what it was but it was $5.50 for 4 small pieces. Lastly I got a smoked salmon roll for $8.95. My bill came out to 23.30. For that amount of money I could have gone to Safeway or even Nijiya in Jtown and gotten much better quality and quantity sushi as well as a bottle of sake. Not coming back.
author: Steven M.

description:
Amazing sushi! I love the atmosphere and people.
We ordered Special B, Super Duper Roll, Dragon Roll and teriyaki for the ones who are not into sushi. Everything was absolutely delicious! I am baffled by how many bad reviews there are on here! We will be coming back next time we come to Chinatown!!
author: Trisha H.

description: Worst place. Long wait for mediocre food, dirty place, and on top of that, we got yelled at for ordering. DO NOT COME HERE
author: Luisa H.

description:
I have never been to a floating boat sushi place before and enjoyed this one for my first time.
It is not a fancy looking restaurant and doesn't have the most amazing sushi ever. But for a quick lunch it was great! I spent $16 for my friend and I and we were full! The cheapest plate is only 99 cents and the most expensive is $5. You get three pieces of sushi on the expensive plates.

I had fun. I do wish that they were making fresh sushi the entire time. No one was replenishing the dishes so you had to make your decision quick. Maybe at dinner time they have someone making the sushi.

The wait staff was a little mean. My friend asked for extra ginger but the waitress told her that she could share with me :/

Other than that I recommend coming here if you have not experience a floating boat sushi restaurant. I am sure that San Francisco probably has nicer ones though!
author: Kamila M.

description:
Very mediocre food and water down drinks 
Charge gratuity automatically 
They are understaffed 
Unacceptable and gross 
Can't believe this business is still in business
author: Tati I.

description:
Goodness gracious, why in the world did I come here for lunch?!

Was it because they offered a sushi boat format? That must have been it, because otherwise I definitely was not thinking when I decided to come to this place for lunch. 

Most of the food offered in the boats were of the fried variant; in other words, this was most likely an attempt to cover up the fact that these sushi ingredients are days old. And even then, the fried stuff tasted overwhelmingly disgusting rather than decent. The seaweed salad tasted like it was a few days old also. 

The one thing that really turned me off about this place: the "fresh salmon" slice they used? It was smoked, like the kind you get from Costco. 

99 cent rolls are not worth it. The only thing I'm thankful for is that I didn't get food poisoning here.
author: Viet N.

description:
It was okay. 
Clearly you go here for the novelty, of the floating boats going around with various dishes. 
You pay by the color of the dish. Each dish contains 2 or 3 pieces of sushi or suede sushi. 
It's okay. 
Chinatown has Japanese and Vietnamese restaurants mixed in. Maybe when in Chinatown, eat Chinese?
author: J B.

description:
If I could I would give this 0 stars.. when my husband and our family and I go to SF to visit we would go here to get a snack

Let me tell you guys we won't be coming back 
The service was horrible didn't refill our waters what so ever.. 


There was only 4 of us and they added tip that has never happened before when the last time we went.. 

We asked the lady who works there why she put tip on the bill and her response was because they have to cook and clean after us.. don't all places do the same thing. 

She was very rude talking back to us like that. And I thought it was 6 or more people that you would add tip then.. 

Overall hats to the chef who made the sushi's it was good but in the end we won't be coming back the next time we come to visit SF
author: Trang T.

description: This is one of the shittiest places you can go for sushi. Cant believe this place is still in business. What a rip off, close 30 dollars for like five tiny ass trays of sushi on a sushi boat. Very disappointed and def wont come back. Should have checked yelp before stepping foot in. Damn
author: Ethyl M.

description:
First and last time coming here!

I usually check the reviews when going to a restaurant for the first time, unfortunatelly, I didn't do so this time, and I regret!

We decided to sit at the bar to grab some sushi from the boats, and it was the best part because the sushi was really good.

HOWEVER, we ordered a chicken teriyaki and a wonton ramen. It took forever (30-40 min) for us to receive our order. And it's understandable sometimes when the place is really busy, but this time there was only another couple and us (3). The wait was not worth because the chicken teriyaki was yet the worst I've ever tried, it was tasteless and poor quality, the ramen was okay.

The service was not the best, and we got added a 10% tip to the check. We didn't notice that until we have already paid.

We asked the server why she added the tip, and she said because it was San Francisco and it was a tourist area. We told her we live in SF and we know about tips, but tips must be optional (10%, 15%, 20%, etc) unless it is a big party they charge tips on the final price. She also said that the manager told her to do that, and that she would talk to him about it!? I don't think so!

SO DISAPPOINTING!
author: Maria A.

description:
I was in SF a few weeks ago and dined at a dim sum restaurant in Chinatown. The very next day my friend sends me a link to an article on sfgate that covered the dirtiest restaurants in town, and that dim sum restaurant was on the list as most likely to make you sick. Wonderful. (I did actually feel a bit sick that day.)

Sooooo, I was suuuuuuper psyched when I recently ate at Floating Sushi and saw their 90 score. Let's be real we're not expecting Narisawa or Jiro dreaming levels of sushi here but it's a solid option for that touristy stretch of Grant Ave.
author: Logan T.

description:
~0 star for this Japanese Wannabe restaurant~
I should have looked up the reviews first! 
The concept is cool but don't fall for it. They need more people to make sushi, I had been sitting for 10 mins and seeing the same type flowing over and over, plus many empty boats just kept on going around. Sushi are below average, the tuna was for sure not fresh. 
Also got the fried ramen with chicken, tastes like crap... the meat is old, chewy and it costs $10. Totally not worth it, I could have made a better version of that.
Service is strange. Staffs don't even understand what their coworkers are doing. I actually had to get up to get my check because it was impossible for me to get their attention. 
Have fun in China town then get your stomach somewhere else to eat. 
AVOID AT ALL COST
author: Krystal G.

description:
This place is so underrated- literally!
It's prices are super convenient for sushi and Asian food. It's clean, and super tasty!
I had some sushi, my friend had some tofu noodle thing. Both were really really good! And our dishes were ready in no time!
There might be a little bit of a language barrier with one of the servers, but it's totally manageable and worth it.

Another plus (a huge one)- it's one of the few restaurants in China Town that accepts credit cards.
author: Lara T.

description: Terrible service. Food was fine, but kinda expensive and terrible service.  Did I mention the terrible service.  I do admit it was quick and easy eat.
author: Leyla C.

description:
Floating Sushi Boat is eye catching and in a great location. BUT DONT BE FOOLED BY ITS ENTICING CONVEYOR BELT OR "99 CENT SPECIAL". A group of friends and I came in because it was the only place opened late on New Years Eve and I can honestly say it's the worst place I've ever eaten at.

We should've checked Yelp before coming in but here is my impression of the place.

Cons:
-The service was atrocious even though the place wasn't full at all. Servers did not charged extra for no reason, and didn't let us cancel the order when the dishes took forever to come out. (Does it take half an hour to make California roll) 
-THE ROLLS TASTED OLD, FLAVORLESS AND NOT FRESH. Shouldn't have gotten sashimi but even the basic CA rolls had rice with an odd mildew taste. 
-The gratuity is automatically charged
-The quality and quantity of the food just wasn't up to par for the price they charge

Pros:
My phone was dying and they didn't say anything when I charged it in one of the outlets.
author: Grace P.

description: There was a cockroach in our Raman Bowl so they dumped our ramen and still charged us partially for the Ramen combo.
author: Cady X.

description: I come to this store to eat sushi every Sunday for almost six years. The Chief of Vi makes delicious sushi, I especially like the fresh Salmon Roll, Unagi and Masago Sushi from him. He is so friendly, he always smile and gives me extra piece of sushi frequently. I really enjoy the customer service of this place from waitress Ling, she is just so great. I always sit down and she serves me well. I always smile after I grab the sushi from this place.
author: Olive C.

description: This is a good quick Sushi spot, sushi is always fresh.  The waitress and cook dont know much English but its ok.  Its pretty easy, sit down at the sushi bar and start eating away.
author: Sergio A.

description: Utterly horrible. Got 2 pieces of California roll. That's 6 actual rolls. Plus two eel rolls. And seaweed salad to chase it before it was horrible. Eel was all fat. Rice in California rolls was wet. Just bad. And we got charged 35 dollars for this snack. Will never go again.
author: Alex T.

description:
I was surprised to see the negative reviews of this place AFTER I ate here. It will feel weird giving this place a decent 4 stars when the restaurant has 1 1/2 stars. I normally check reviews of places before I eat, but my mother and I were just so hungry, that we just walked in to any restaurant sitting in Chinatown. I guess what you don't know can't hurt you. The food wasn't so bad, and the service was, well, okay? My mother and I just asked for water and hot tea, and got our food from the sushi conveyor,  so we weren't that high maintenance.  We just picked up anything for grabs.

Food was decent and not too expensive. I get pretty full off sushi very easily, so I didn't have to spend so much on food. I do like the à la carte style because you don't have to order a huge entree and leave the rest to waste. 

Moral of the story: Give businesses the benefit of the doubt...well, some. This was the exception.
author: Renee C.

description: I was happy. I see a lot of bad reviews but i thought it was great. I've always wanted to try a price by the plate sushi place so this was perfect
author: DeNae M.

description:
This is my second time at this sushi place. I never thought it has such a low score. I wonder if it is because of the service because the lady there is rather abrasive and rude.
After a long meditation at a nearby temple, I feel like dimsum isn't right so I went back to this place. For sushi, it is best to eat where you had ate and not felt sick. Raw fishes (or raw meat in general) are sensitive subject to human function.
Must've admitted, compared to other sushi restaurants on Grant, a tourists' street, and other floating sushi places (including my favorite non-floating- Elephant), in my opinion, this is one of the average. Hence, definitely not expensive. 
I absolutely love the chef this afternoon. He was attentive, kind and wonderful. My head was filled with emotional memories since it was my father's 10 years memorial, my eyes were watering at time. He talked me out of it. Felt perfectly full, happy and gonna be back soon ;)
On a second note, I'm sorry but I don't like the server lady there. Really not worth my $10 tips. It was all for the chef! Later when the check came, she didnt even take it but the chef handled it to me. The chip on my card had some problem and she talked very loud to me asking for cash and all. I didn't have enough so I asked to try again. Her attitude wasn't corporate at all. Failed again. It happened a couple times before at CVS so I am sure it wasn't my card. I stepped in the cashier table and pulled her asides ;))) I did it myself, swiped the card i/o and it worked! I showed it to her and she didn't even apologize! I told her next time she should be calm. Her way is no way close should be treated customers. Our $ provided food on your mouth and rent on your head so at least, give some courtesy. Like I will run out without pay or so.
The chef came and apologized so many times. I mentioned he was great, it was her attitude that Made me upset. She walked out and had her dinner!?! How rude! I wished I had enough cash to give $ directly to the chef i/o writing on my card!
The owner seriously needs to train her again or do something about this!!!!!!
author: Bao V.

description: Didn't have the sushi. However the ramen and the beef teriyaki was amazing. The gentlemen behind the sushi was very nice. But the food was grest. I would diffinently go back.
author: Jose R.

description:
Traveled across the world, some countries are known not to have service, but US is known to have a customer service on a high level. This is definitely worst service in my life. You don't get any welcome, words like "hello", "thank you", "anything else?", "please" and so on are unknown to people there. They really hate that you came there.

Food is ok, but not worth the price. But if you don't pay a tip (for what?) then price is ok.

Three is a waiter there but better if they didn't have one.
author: Klim K.

description:
Half way through an adventurous day in Chinatown With my fiancé and his brother, we got a little hungry and I had to use the restroom. ( I know that if you are going to use a business's bathroom you should probably buy something.) So we walked in and asked to be seated at the sushi boats. The male sushi chef was nice and asked if we liked our food. The lady server on the other hand seemed to want to rush us into ordering off the menu. We didn't order anything, just had a couple plates each from the boats (6 in total) plus waters. Mostly just California rolls and I had some rolls with eel on them. The food was OK (besides the fried rolls being cold) but I constantly felt rushed to order something and the lady didn't seem happy when we didn't.. 

In total we were probably there between 15-20 minutes. When we went up to pay it was over $35. Which is fine but I'm pretty sure she rounded up and added her tip in there. Lol. 2 stars because the sushi was ok and the chef was nice but I won't be back.
author: Amanda M.

description:
If I could give this place zero stars... I would! 

BY FAR THE WORST PLACE I'VE EATEN IN MY LIFE!

First if all, the place was extremely dirty. They had baking pans (they served the food with) all over the tables and against the walls.

Second, they servers were extremely rude! They talk all over you and don't listen to anything you're saying. They yell at each other in Chinese across the whole restaurant. Our server would forget our check everytime we asked, it was in her pocket! -_- I also noticed a costumer trying to order his food but the server just kept talking over him and suggesting something else I guess? She had. A THICK accent.

Third, the food had no flavor at all! And they kept forgetting my daughter's rice (but it was surprisingly good) and my sister's California Roll.

Over all, not coming back here ever again. Sorry, I know it's Christmas but that doesn't mean you can be rude to all your costumers and yell at each other across the restaurant.
author: Jessica R.

description: $70 for a lunch!!?? Fees were crept upon me, I had 3 kids and myself.  Ordered lunch special,  one lunch, 4 drinks and a bill (that I couldn't understand) came to $70??? Food mediocre
author: Sandra G.

description:
This restaurant sits in the heart of Chinatown. We saw it just walking down Grant Street. 

One of the main things that may catch your eye is that they have dishes starting at 99¢. Which may be appealing to some. Based on this shouldn't have had expectations based on my favorite sushi restaurants. Upon eating some sushi we picked up from the floating boat, I noticed that the fish was not warm but not cold and the rice didn't seem fresh either. So I ordered some sushi from the menu, like the spicy tuna roll and like the one from the boat, not that much better. 

My friend that went with me got about 10 dishes from the boat and 1 sushi dish from the menu and just his cost around $30. At this rate you can find a good ACE sushi restaurant. Which would have more specialty rolls and it would probably be a lot fresher. 

I wouldn't suggest going here.
author: Thee N.

description: The waitress couldn't talk in low tone. She yells loudly right next to your ear when answering a simply question. The menu is confusing, we wanted noodles, rice and some sushi. We ordered the noodles and rice  with the help of the loud waitress and grabbed a few trays of sushi off the boats. The food sucked and the place was a dump. I think the boats is the draw to get you in after that it's a failure and nothing special. It was cold and none inviting when eating here.
author: Doug B.

description: I don't know who the people are who rated this place 1-2 stars! I live in SF and never get to Chinatown; typically I don't do touristy stuff. We happened upon this joint while I was showing my parents around. We ate lunch here and the sushi/fish was supper fresh. The sushi chef was very nice. My parents ordered more traditional meals (teriyaki salmon bowls and bento boxes) and they loved it. I would definitely come back.
author: Alexandria B.

description:
Came here with a few friends a few days ago because we had never had a sushi boat experience, which in theory seemed to be interesting and fun. We were sadly mistaken... From the few plates we tried, the sushi did not seem fresh at all. We figured we would try something else, so I ordered the chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura combination, one of my friends ordered the same thing, and the other ordered the beef teriyaki and tempura combination. We all agreed that the meat had been cold as if they had not cooked it or they just microwaved it... The food was not good and we noticed several Yelpers complaining that they got sick from it (which made us very nervous). However, I can't say that any of us did get sick, but the food was just a big no-no. Its not expensive, but the food truly explains why.

The service was absolutely horrible. In order to order, we had to stand up and come to the woman to get her attention and order and again when we wanted the check. She would not check on us unless we got her attention by waving at her.

Overall, would not recommend this place at all, go somewhere else for sushi boats!
author: Steven P.

description: Floating sushi boat is unethical and does not charge customers accurately. They're prices per plate are $0.99, $1.99, $2.99, $3.99, and $4.99. However when I got the bill, they rounded up all the numbers and charged me $1, $2, $3, $4, and $5 respectively. Also, they included gratuity into my bill without my consent. A few cents difference doesn't matter but it's a principle matter. The fact that they don't accurately charge customers is not right and goes against business ethics. Zero integrity!
author: Eric H.

description: AWFUL, AWFUL! The service was the worse when we decided to order from the menu instead of the boat. The sushi on the boat looked like it had been on the boat for a few hours. Another customer was dissatisfied as well with the food. And to top it off, they charged a pre-tip!!! This is done to African American patrons all the time! This place SUCKS! Don't go! And it's not clean!
author: Elena Q.

description: This place was awesome and sad to see all the negative reviews! Fresh and fast and the sushi was wonderful! And you can get dessert and watermelon on the little boats. We got drinks fast and the waitress and cook were great!
author: Amber W.

description: While exploring the city my friend and I got hungry and decided to try this place despite all the bad reviews.  Service was okay and food was questionable so we decided to order from the menu instead because we did not know how long the fish had been sitting around for. Long story short, It was okay.... definitely not the best, but we didn't get sick (that's what matters right?).
author: Danielle F.

description: Bad food, high prices and absolutely horrible service. The sushi chef was very nice but the waitress/hostess was very rude and disgusting!!
author: Karen J.

description: Raw meat with ramen having bugs in it and the waitress is the rudest person ever, clearly she hates her job and she has the audacity to add the tip to the bill. Avoid even if you are dying of hunger. I rather eat nothing then spend my money on this place.
author: Sana B.

description: The shtick of sushi floating by on boats is really fun. Its not the best sushi, but it's also not bad.  It was lots of fun to look at the different rolls floating by and the prices were reasonable. We were glad we stopped.
author: Leslie B.

description:
Brought my mom here for lunch during our day off. We were patient about the stern look and mumbling, only because they had just opened and our waitress was older. Our sushi roll was missing ingredients and the ramen and meat had a spoiled plastic smell. I paid the full price and tipped her because I've worked in hospitality, plus didn't want to ruin the rest of our day. BEWARE! 
I should have read the reviews before stepping in.
author: Maricela V.

description: Horrible service. I'd much prefer self serve at this point... hostess and waitress just puts my family and I off. Would not come a second time. Ever.
author: Leo L.

description: We wanted to like this place but the soup was tasteless & the salmon was burned! Just a bad experience. The service was rushed. No handicapped bathroom. You have to walk downstairs. Not recommended.
author: Shelly S.

description:
They truly live up to their 1 and a half star review. :) My friends and I went there on New Year's Eve hoping to get some cravings satisfy but once we entered the restaurant there were barley any other customers. In fact without reading the Yelp reviews we blindly tried out this place. The women who served us kept on ignoring us when we needed something like spoons and napkins. Our food took around 30-45 minutes to make especially when the sushi came out, we were really upset since it didn't look fresh and it tasted kind of stale. I definitely DO NOT recommend going there unless you want to try some stale rice, un-fresh fish and salty udon! 

BTW the tips and everything is added on for you and for $13 you can either get a plate of sushi combo or even a bowl of udon!
author: Jeanne T.

description:
This has to be the worst sushi place ever. They have sushi on a conveyer belt (which is great) however, this is how it works; whatever sushi plate you pick up you pay for! The plates range from .99 - $4.99. Now, this was not explained to us when we first came in. They pushed us into the sushi bar area, now I know why. 
Where I come from the sushi is all you can eat from the conveyer belt. So we usually eat a lot of sushi, like we did here. Well that's NOT the case. Not to mention, they watch over you like a hawk. 
This restaurant is weird all together! I will never come back.
author: Marsena V.

description:
Normally we check a place out online before deciding to dine. Unfortunately for us we walked past the window of Floating Sushi Boat and were intrigued by the eye catching conveyor of sushi. 

The middle aged woman who greeted us and took our order was very abrasive, thus starting what would not be a good experience.

Once seated the sushi chef explained to us how the conveyor operation worked - everything was simple enough.

Having worked in the sushi industry for 4 years I'm very familiar with how certain food items should look. The conveyor held several items that looked as though they should have been pulled hours before during lunch time. On top of that they already had some 12 dishes pre made just sitting out on one of the counters within the sushi bar to replace the plates as they were pulled.

I grabbed one item off of the belt at $4.99 and it was okay, I also ordered their special of orange ginger teriyaki chicken bowl which was priced around $10. The salmon, crab, and cucumber roll up was okay - salmon looked a little iffy but tasted fine. The chicken bowl came with a miso soup that tasted like salty water with a hint of miso flavor. The chicken bowl was horrific, with the name of teriyaki I assumed I was getting something broiled or grilled in a soy type glaze with the 'orange and ginger' flavors incorporated somehow. What I received was instead a deep fried pounded chicken soggy from a flavorless sauce sitting atop a mound of mushy improperly prepared white rice. No vegetables, flavorless sauce, and terrible quality overcooked deep fried chicken with a soggy crust due to the sauce.
author: Clay W.

description: It's a shame they didn't let me tip (automatically included gratuity of 10%)  because I would have given less if I could. I don't usually write yelp reviews but eating here was an incredible turnoff as the quality of sushi and complete lack of variety was extremely disappointing. The unsanitary conditions made the food even less appetizing. The plates are overpriced and to top it off the amount of fish to rice ratio was done cheaply given their prices. Don't make the same mistake I did by not looking at their yelp reviews and only paying attention to the aesthetics of this restaurant and keep out. My suggestion to the workers there is to put some more variety on the plates rather than two bitesize pieces of watermelon or seaweed salad and charging a couple dollars for that. I think I had a harder time trying to choose a plate off the sushi boats than it was to trek up the hills of San Francisco.
author: Won-Jae S.

description: I walked into this place for lunch with my niece and nephew. I wouldn't normally walk into an unknown place in a very touristy area, but was tempted, against my better instincts, by the opportunity to give my guests a first-time sushi boat experience. It was a mistake. Upon sitting down, I was shocked by the rudeness of the lady who waited on us. She literally threw the wasabi plates at us. The sushi itself was mediocre. To cap off our unpleasant experience, we had an unannounced, 'mandatory' tip added to our credit card bill. Their main product, sushi, was not terrible, just very mediocre. I will never come back.
author: Sergio E.

description: This was more than disappointing. Food didn't have anything good about it but worst of all was the rudeness of its staff. I should have know there was something wrong with this establishment when I walked in and was stared at.
author: Alain G.

description: The sushi and the menu items were good. The prices for the sushi boats are extremely confusing and it's easy to pay more than you expect. The waitress is rude and not attentive but that is probably because she is the only waitress working the whole place. Our water cups were dirty and the water was obviously tap. Overall I would not come here again.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Wish I can give this place zero star.

Definitely DEFINITELY the worst restaurant I have ever been to, in San Francisco, and one of the worst in the U.S... and possibly in the world (I'm a frequent traveler).  I'm usually very generous with reviews and give good ratings, but I have absolutely nothing good to say about this restaurant.  

Here are the bad, the bad, and the ugly:

Bad: false advertisement.  Their signs said $.99 and up sushi boats, there was practically no $.99 boats other than cookies and other random filler food.  Higher priced boats had real sushi, but overall not good value for the price. PLUS, the food on the boats did not look fresh at all.  Also, they advertised out front that they have 4 draft beer, but when we sat down and asked about it the waitress said they only have two options (Sapporo and Blue Moon).

Bad: terrible (and non-existent) service. No one who worked there was friendly.  Not the waitress, not the "sushi chef", not the lady at the cash register.  The waitress sat us by the sushi boats after we walked in, took our drink orders, then pretty much just disappeared.

Ugly: The Boba drinks.  That's the ONLY reason I even went into the restaurant- i was craving a boba drink.  I saw on the store front that they had a large variety of boba drinks, so we in and I ordered one.  After the waitress took our drink orders and disappeared for more than half an hour, we were done with eating and ready to head out.  Still no boba.  hmm.  My fiance went to the waitress and asked about it, she walked right out of the restaurant to the shop next door, and picked up the boba drink from them!!!  WHAT?!   Even worse, the drink tasted awful.  All the boba were stuck together as one big chunk, and they did not come up through the straws.  I just threw it out.

OVERALL, awful awful awful awful AWFUL place.  Don't go there unless you have no other options... even starving is a better option.
author: Sarah W.

description: Horrible place, not a good idea to not look at review before walking in. We have to be re seated twice, saw one of the servers coming from the back with stacks of soup bowl. She laid out the bowls on the table and putting tofu and green onions on the bowl with her bare hands with a disgusting dirty right thumb nail. We end up walking away. Plus long wait anyway we decided to leave after 40 mins of waiting after they sat us and take our orders.
author: Gel C.

description:
I was so excited to see this on a corner in Chinatown. I didn't think anything when I grabbed something that looked like something I would normally eat. I didn't pay attention to the fact the 'meat' inside of the 'sushi' was brown ish. I couldn't pin down the texture because it was wrapped in rice, fried, then some spicy mayo and scallions. I offered my boyfriend a bite but he declined and gave me a funny look. I didn't think why, he is weird. I still have NO idea what I ate. Was it fish? (I've never seen one look brown like this) Was it Eel? (wrong texture) Was it a mistake? (probably) I'm chalking this up to an experience, a learning experience. My stomach was not in crazy pain, but it wasn't loving me either. 

The boyfriend grabbed tuna and salmon rolls, which were easily identifiable. He said they were ok, no complaints. I also picked these fried pouches that were filled with sweet rice. They weren't BAD, but I was hoping for something more. 

Overall, I would love to try one of these places where it was a little cleaner, a little more english-speaking friendly, and I understood what exactly I was grabbing.
author: Christina G.

description:
We wandered around Chinatown and sampled a few restaurants to get a good variety. 
The Floating Boat was a novelty. A "moat" in the table floats different colored plates around the table and diners select the items desired. Pricing is based on the color of the plate selected. 
The quality and selection is actually pretty mediocre. It's decent, fresh and not bad but there's nothing amazing about it, either. I definitely opt for sitting at the prep counter in good sushi establishments and getting the more exotic and elaborate sushi option. The options here are very plain. The three stars is for the fun and easy experience - it's fast, price is reasonable, and very low key. 
Unlike the fancier sushi restaurants that lend to dressier, longer, more intimate meals, this is a jeans-are-okay, diner style, good-for-lunch stop.
author: Jenny D.

description: Wow definitely should have checked Yelp ratings. This is literally the worst place I have ever eaten. Don't go here. Ever.
author: Ryan Dongseok K.

description: Customise and make your own sushi..amazing fresh watermelon juice ..really refreshing!
author: Priyanka L.

description:
If you're looking for HORRIBLE service from a rude waitress and some mediocre sushi, then come here. 
Tip: Order from the chef, DON'T pick up anything raw that is on the conveyor belt AKA floating boat- the items are NOT very fresh.
The lesson: pay that extra dollar or two, and go ANY other sushi bar around town.
author: Mister Z.

description: Not that great. Not sure I like the idea of the sushi floating around on boats. I like mine freshly rolled. Had ginger chicken with rice... it was OK. place is a little overpriced. Can't give more than 2 stars since they automatically charged a tip to my credit card while only eating with a party of two. Very lame.
author: Westwood D.

description:
Stay away. Yuck gross.  I made the mistake of not checking my yelp before sitting. ...well no,  truthfully I'd been flying all day and my phone was dead.  This was the place that was open and I didn't feel like a mess sitting in here. 

The food treated gross unfresh and I found a piece of plastic on my food. The sushi was hard as a rock.  

The older folks working in there meant well and were nice but the food is bad.  Sorry. .. not sorry
author: Stephanie J.

description: The server was so mean. She was unprofessional and hard to approach. I can really tell from her body language that she don't give a ****. I wasn't able to digest my food because of her. I don't appreciate her attitude. I give her the benefit of the doubt that maybe it's not her day, but she should know better how customer service goes.
author: Ninja L.

description:
We were looking for a place to have dinner. We must have went in and out of this place 2-3 times trying to decide if we should or not. Nothing about the place really appealed to us. The deciding factor was just the idea of sitting at the bar and having the sushi float by and grabbing what you want.  We should have #1, went with our instinct and fled, and #2, checked yelp!!

The ramen and soba noodle soup was soooo bland!  The sushi seemed like it was going around in the boat a very long time (nothing appealing). and service was sad :(. And for 2 (one being a child) it cost $40. Just had 2 bowls of soup and 3 or 4 sushi platter!  PLUS, beware...gratuity was automatically added.
author: M M.

description: Service SUCKS, they brought extra food which we didn't order, and brought some food that we ordered 20 minutes after most of our groups food. The Server was pretty rude when we told her some food still hadnt come and that there was food we didn't order. The sushi and food overall was okay, not the best.
author: Monica M.

description: We came in here because the sushi boats looked really enticing. NOPE. Should have gone to Yelp first!! The food was not fresh at all and the chicken teriyaki was cold. Also the sushi could have been sitting around all day. Don't be fooled by the 99 cent signs!! Health inspection grade was at 72/100. STAY AWAY.
author: Matthew H.

description:
This is the worst Sushi in the city. Not only is the service bad but also the bad service comes with a huge portion of  bad attitude.

I've been here twice and both times the service was horrible and the sushi was lacking that fresh flavor that you can get anywhere else in the city.

I guess if your just in from Des Moines, Iowa then you may enjoy it, other than that then please stay away.
author: Justin S.

description: Terrible food and service. I have never been to a worse place like this restaurant. The miso soup was like salt water. The lady who brought food to our table had no attitude. She was so rude. It was a big mistake for us to eat at that restaurant. The worse sushi, worse service in Chinatown. They take the tip without asking the customer. I hope everybody checks this restaurant out before making decision. This would ruin your day or night if you eat here.
author: Tuoi L.

description: While I did not have sushi here, I was extremely disappointed. I ordered a boba drink, and it was a joke. Basically, it was kool-aid with maybe ten tapioca pearls and a few ice cubes.  Plus, we had to wait forever. Do not go here.
author: Karen B.

description: Gross warm sushi. Avoid!! Wish I had looked at Yelp before going. Had 2 pieces and walked out. Yuck! Praying I don't get sick.
author: Andrew R.

description: Ate here for lunch with my gf two days ago and now i feel sick.... Ive been having chills, bad diahrea, and nausia for one day. Now my gf ia feeling it too. The service was terrible. Asian lady reminded me of Frowl from austin powers with an angryish low tone. The sushi was not fresh.....hints why i feel sick now, overpriced and the add/ protion on the window is bs. Only 99 cents i saw was for edamami. If u want to grt sick and sit on thr toilet for days...thrn uvcome to the right place. I would give 0 stars if i could
author: Jordeezy F.

description: The service was ok. The food came really fast. It just took a couple of minutes. The vegetarian temporal was great. Also the ramen bowls. I would recommend this restaurant for a short and filling lunch .
author: Eva S.

description:
Terrible terrible terrible.. Took forever fifths waitress to come over.  

I order the  tonkstsu ramen.. Basically the .99 cent verity from the drug store.. Here it was $12 :) yuck didn't even eat just left.

Should of read the reviews first.
author: David O.

description: This is probably the worst sushi I have experienced in the Bay Area. We first ordered salmon sushi nigiri. The salmon looked and smelt bad, so we didnt eat it. We complained about it, but the hostes did not take it off the bill. The hostess is so poor at service that she probably was trained at United Airlines. The chicken in the chicken terryaki was ok, but the vegetables were close to destroyed by the cooking. When we looked around we saw almost entirely European visitors - most likely one-time visitors - who didnt know how bad this place is. I went even if I had read the bad reviews. Cudos to Yelp and their reviewers for providing accurate information. Stay away from Floating Sushi Boat everyone!
author: Peder F.

description: My boyfriend ordered the pork ramen and only got three slices of pork in his whole bowl for 11 dollars, I got a sushi platter and it was mostly rice, we came in for the one dollar sushi and there wasn't even one plate of dollar sushi on the entire circle of boats. Easily one of the worst dining experiences I've had, no wonder they have mandatory gratuity in their check(since nobody in their right mind would tip). One piece of "sushi" was just rice wrapped in tofu, this place should cease to operate already.
author: Laurie O.

description: Horrible service, disappointing food, overpriced. We were ignored for extended periods of time. Would not recommend.
author: Emily R.

description:
Like many of the previous reviews, I would give this place a negative star if possible.

The floating pieces of shit at a crack house toilet would be more hygienic than the food served here.
We were seated by the rude boss who immediately starts bashing racist slurs with the chef since she didn't think we spoke the same language due to the fact both my friend and I are mixes. 

I should've known better when I realized we were the only ones in the restaurant. Me being Japanese, I let my excitement overtake my instincts. An unfortunate decision, a very unfortunate decision.

The seats we were seated were dirty, there were flies flying around the sushi on the boats. The tuna itself were literally GRAY and HARD. God only knows how long they've been there circulating, probably since the start of the century... (We were there around 6pm.) The "99 cent" plates were dirt covered cookies and jello. 

On top of that, they use intricate plates designed to easily confuse expensive plates with cheap prices.

The waitress told me they didn't have some of the items on the menu available so I settled for a floating plate of Ikura (Roe eggs) and Salmon Sushi. I felt immediate sharp stomach pains within the hour....

What finally compelled me to write this very brutal and honest review was the fact they tacked on a 15% gratuity onto our bill. My 2 plates came out to over $11 while my friend's 2 plates came out to $9. We were basically forced to pay 15% for racist service, disgusting/rotting food and a molding building to dine (may die in?) in. 

Running your tongue on a bed of nails in hell would prove to be more healthy and appealing than wasting your money at this establishment that should really, really be shut down by the FDA.

Tourists, you have been warned.
author: A S.

description:
Horrible place. I can give 1 star because the food was not that bad, but the place is filthy and the service is inexistent. Rude waitresses that take your order in bad manners and then disappear for the rest of your time there. We didn't even get a refill in our water cups. When you go to the restrooms, you get a glimpse of the disorganized, disgusting, filthy kitchen; if I had gone to the restrooms before ordering, I would have left.
Besides, they charged us with a 10% tip, which in our case was $12. We left just $10 and they were shameless enough to come back to our table and demand the missing $2. 
Just don't go.
author: Alice Z.

description: DON'T GO!!! The worst Sushi I ever had! Very dirty and extremely expensive! They took 20% gratitude extra than tax and the price! VERY RUDE with the worst service!!! I never ever go again!!! I wish I had read the reviews before going there :(
author: Amir G.

description:
Why Yelp, WHY can't we give negative stars?!?!?

I knew this place probably wasn't the best but the signage on the windows drew me in.  I figured I could get a few 99 cent pieces to hold me over because I was starving an tired after work and shopping. 

They do NOT offer anything for 99 cents.  Also, they have menus with prices that are apparently incorrect by what the waitress said after I had already ate and knowing full well that i pointed to the item on that same menu. I said that she needs to pull that whole stack on menus but she just grunted at me without looking at me and slapped the bill down.

Anyway, I know my people, especially the restaurant workers that can be considered rude but most at least try to a certain extent.  The lady here was just...  Horrible.  It wasn't busy.  She was rude all around, not getting up to get anything for anyone, not even menus.  

Anyway, avoid at all cost.  Food is not fresh and I am certain enough to say that you will probably get sick on anything in the boats unless its hella busy and they are constantly refilling with new dishes.  Even then...  I watched the sushi chef come back from lunch to make some new sushi and it didn't really look like they have a good grasp on food safety.

'Nuff said.
author: Jackie C.

description: Horrible horrible place! If I could give 0 stars I would! The ladies were rude and talked bad about us in Chinese and also charged us extra for food that tasted like paper
author: Jennifer K.

description: I'm standing outside the restaurant right now as I'm reading all these reviews... Don't wanna go in anymore.  :O
author: Mendy _.

description: Atrocious! This place will get you sick. The food is almost inedible. The sushis smell like old fish. The waiters are ignoring you when they don't bring you the check. Barf bag highly recommended if you choose to eat there. Restaurant is a health hazard and should be investigated by FDA, ASAP, before someone dies from food poisoning.
author: James L.

description: Yes, it is as bad as the Yelp ratings indicate! My mistake that I didn't check Yelp before sitting down to eat. Always trust the wisdom of Yelpers ... always! Where do I start. To begin with, most of the boats were empty except a few that had seaweed salad, stale looking mushroom salad, or slices of pineapple. We ordered the sushi (nigiri) and tonkatsu ramen but the quality of both was very bad. I also think the sushi chefs were overwhelmed -- only two of them serving the whole restaurant! Then, service was terrible -- the staff were rough and had no notion of customer service. The inside ambience was just ok. The only thing going for this restaurant -- and the reason we fell for it -- is its location: right in the middle of Chinatown.
author: N. D.

description: Went here because I was in the area and I didn't check Yelp. Now I have sharp stomach pains and food poisoning. I can't say for sure I got it here but I have a strong suspicion.
author: Digant K.

description:
Visited on Jan 1st.  Got to sit at the rotating sushi bar.
Sushi  not good, not bad.  I've certainly had better sushi.
They had a good selection of rolls to try and you pay by the plate, which could get expensive if you are not paying attention to the cost of the plate with sushi you are grabbing to eat. 
Great location in Chinatown.
Mileage may vary depending on the day, time, and available sushi moat.its rounds in the sushi moat.
author: Shawn R.

description:
Literally one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant. I walked in here with low expectations and yet, this is beyond grasp. The atmosphere is honestly gross. The floors look like it hasn't been mopped in months and the tables are greasy and grimy. They show off a health inspection plaque with a score of '90' as you walk in. You know it's a bad place when they have to show off how 'clean' they are, especially a score of '90,' which local McDonald's get better scores.

Edit: Look up the restaurant on the health inspection website. Literally a score of 70's prior. Absolutely repulsive.

The food was sub par and overly expensive. The sushi on the boats were stone cold and repulsive. Three small rolls for 5 dollars is an insane amount for a joke of a dish. The nice thing is you can truly taste the 'quality.'

I ordered the beef teriyaki donburi. The donburi i had was disgusting and the size of a small rice bowl. The teriyaki reeked of cheap processed canned goods and the rice was ice cream cold. The beef was a struggle to get down considering it was undercooked and smothered with the foul sauce. Considering it took 20 minutes to make this 10 dollar mediocre bowl, not again ever.

And don't even ask me about the customer service. When I asked one of the servers "What would you recommend" and "how big was the Donburi?," she rudely told me to go outside and look at the photos. How f-ing rude. When I asked another server, she didn't understand English. I get better service at a Mcdonald's drive-thru for god sakes.

I made the mistake of walking into this place because I saw it was slightly crowded. Boy was I wrong. Choose some other place. Any place. You're better off eating dog food. It's probably cleaner and better tasting.
author: Polo T.

description: Very low quality customer service and the amount of the food given for the price it is was totally not worth it.
author: Angelina S.

description: Received nothing except overpriced bad sushi, bad service, and food poisoning from this establishment. Just say no, people. Not worth the shittiness (literally) you'll feel afterwards.
author: Willa P.

description:
Less than Average Sushi-- but floating sushi boat concept is cool. 

I was a tourist in Chinatown and immediately got excited when I saw this place due to the "floating sushi boats" I'm from the Midwest and never seen anything like this before. When I got there, I immediately realized that it was all presentation and the sushi wasn't spectacular. It's also slightly pricey and you'll end up calculating how much each of your plates are, instead of enjoying them. Service is slightly slow and you'll have to awhile for new sushi to go onto the boats.
author: Thao P.

description: We love this place. Don't come in expecting 5 star service....Here is how to enjoy the Floating Boat: Walk in and stand there so they can bark at you to sit wherever you like. You can just come in and sit down, but why miss the whole experience? Go sit at the boat bar. They will give you a menu but you'll have to flag them down to order from it and then they'll appear to be perturbed that you did.  Make sure you ask for everything you want including wasabi, because they don't come back to check on you. You literally have to flag them down. There are placards that show you how much each little plate on the boats will cost you. Just stop the boat and take what you want. It seems as though I'm complaining about the service but to be honest they were so curt that it was comical. The sushi is made fresh and it is delicious. We didn't bother to order off the menu anyway. If we ever make our way to Chinatown again, we will most definitely return.
author: Percella S.

description:
There are times when I hate myself for being so easily amused.  This is definitely one of them:

"Oh my gosh!  Floating sushi boats instead of a conveyor belt?!? O-M-G!  We must go in!"  

With those exact words (including the O, M, and G), that's how they sucked me in.  After watching the boats go around twice with over-priced and discolored sushi, I was no longer amused, but rather disgusted.  Also, $3.95 for 3 pieces of California Roll?  REALLY?  

For those who might get sucked in for the $.99 sushi plates -- you're only going to be able to get either a BBQ pork bun (neither Sushi nor Japanese) or the cucumber-radish roll. 

Do yourself a favor and just STAY AWAY.
author: Calvin Y.

description:
When I came here on the 1st time with my friend and her sister, I actually had a decent time here and the food wasn't that bad. On this visit however, I've made some observations and I find this place to have some bad service and the food wasn't really that good. 

Today, I arrived with two of my friends from college and they wanted to see Chinatown in San Francisco so we decided to head there for fun. After exploring the area, we were hungry and found this place to what I've remember was pretty good and pointed it out. We decided to head there and order food. I ordered the bento box which came with rice, teriyaki chicken, edamame, california rolls, and honeydew boba. When the lady came up for us to order, one of the things that I always ask when I order boba tea is that if the flavor mentioned on the menu is for milk tea or green tea because I'm lactose intolerant. When I asked if it was milk tea, she said "no, no milk" so I say sure I'll order one. When the drink arrived, it had milk.... Not really wanting to start a problem, I decided to try it and see if I could even finish it. One sip from it, and it tasted pretty bad. I asked my friend to try it to see if it was just me and she didn't find it pleasant either. I left the drink there and didn't bother finishing it (it was practically full).

Next, our dishes arrived. The bento box that I order was "meh". the teriyaki chicken had no flavor, the edamame had no salt, and the california rolls was really small. Overall not really impressed by their food on the menu but their sushi was actually decent, so if you're going there to eat, go for the sushi, it is your safest bet on a decent meal (though I would suggest trying to find another spot)

Services and hospitality here are bad. In here, my friend had asked for a fork and straw which the lady took a while to get it. Other people (most likely tourists) were also not pleased with the services, as some were ignored and had to call the waitress several times to ask what she wanted. The place itself at the time was not really busy but not empty either. Then another thing I've seen was the waitress was doing tasks while she was on her cellphone, which in my opinion, is pretty unprofessional of them. I feel like the only reason they have so many customers is because they are tourists and that was the first restaurant they spotted and showed that it had a boat serving you food. 

I would honestly suggest to try to find another place to eat. There is so many other choices in Chinatown to pick from with similar menus and their food quality and service are better than this.
author: Tito G.

description:
I should've read the Yelp reviews before I came to this place.

I thought that since the boats were upwards of 3.99/boat, that they would be half decent. I was wrong. The fish was dried and the rice stale. Who knows how long this sushi was left out before I paid too much for it. I ordered a rainbow roll and it was made fresh but I didnt get off that easy. For a rainbow roll and 6.5 (I couldnt finish a .99 cent boat) pieces of sushi, I took a 29.00 hit. 

Will never come back here and was EXTREMELY tempted to tell customers to run away as I say there trying to figure out why I decided to come here in the first place.
author: Greg S.

description: tried the pork belly ramen and it's not on point in the least. had a couple California rolls and they were good but nothing special. whack!
author: Jose D.

description:
Sooooo HORRIBLE ! Came exploring to Chinatown with friends and we were super hungry, and saw .99 / piece sushi advertisement outside, we weren't so sure about it but we thought why not ? Let's try a few pieces and if not we'll leave.

Idk what it was but the smell in there was disgusting. I love sushi and I'm not sensitive to any fish smells but when the waitress seated us by the sushi boats, it just smelled like dirty sour mildew. It was really gross! Maybe they should actually clean the water tank the boats float on. 

Now on to the sushi, only tried 3 plates with only 2-3 pieces of sushi on them. Total $14.40, A little pricey for the worst sushi ever. The .99/ pieces were just the California rolls and all the other ones were 2.99-4.99/ plate.. Oh and they added their own gratuity even though there was only 3 of us, okay whatevs. 

SOOO all in all, don't waste your time or your money here. Go to better sushi places around the area instead.
author: Paulie P.

description: Walking around China town in SF and my gf saw a picture of chicken katsu on their window..MISTAKE not checking out yelp first! The service sucks, the food sucks, just avoid coming here. Rookie mistake of us walking into a place only because some fake picture of some dish they didn't even make.
author: Wendy R.

description: This place was awful. First of all, our first mistake was going to Chinatown for sushi. No! Should have just just checked yelp before trying it. I had a few of their sushi from the boats. They didn't taste very fresh and I was sitting there for quite a while and noticed that some of the dishes had been going around the belt since before I had arrived. NOT FRESH. I ordered the tonkatsu Ramen to steer clear of the u fresh fish and it was the Plainest I have ever had. The broth was milky and I wanted to ask what other broths they offered for their Ramen but I didn't think she knew what I was talking about. At the end of the night we ended up paying like 60 for like 5 plates of sushi that wasn't even good. Over all. Just terrible presentation and the customer service was non existent. Don't come here people.
author: Cassandra G.

description:
Really rude staff. I sat down at the bar and was asked if I wanted a drink. I asked for tea. "That costs extra," the waitress snapped at me. Wow, can't say I expected it to be free o_o. She was really terse and unpleasant any time I interacted with her. Gratuity is automatically calculated into your bill - probably a smart move, as I can't imagine many patrons being generous with their tips here.

As for the food itself, it was below average quality. I've actually been to sushi establishments with similar motifs where the food was good, so this was disappointing. Some of the food floating around looked pretty terrifying - I spotted a few maki that had been turned into unidentifiable globs of tempura. The seaweed salad was fine. The nigiri didn't taste very fresh. It's probably a good thing that they had a sneeze guard, as there were a number of flies roaming about (a total deal-breaker for me when it comes to food).

As a side note, I didn't really like how difficult it was so gauge the price of dishes. Other places I've been to generally use readily identifiable colors, whereas Floating Sushi Boat has patterns on their dishes, some of which look a bit similar, so I had to keep consulting their price guide as the dishes went around.

There are a plethora of sushi restaurants in the immediate area. Stay away from this one.
author: Jade M.

description: I do not think this place does or will anytime in the future deserve 5 stars; however, I do not see why it would get one star. There is 99¢ sushi but no sushi for 99¢ is going to be great sushi. It is overpriced for the quality of the food though. I had an Unagi plate which was $3.99 (which is decently priced considering how expensive eel can be at other restaurants) and Nabeyaki ramen which was $12. Unagi was very fresh and flavorful but the ramen left more to be desired. It wasn't horrible or anything just extremely average and especially for $12. The sushi boats are a very neat idea! Just pay attention to the design of the plate you're getting because they can add up. Overall, this place isn't horrible or great, just an average place that's overpriced.
author: Selena M.

description: It is a cool concept and the floating boats are very fun to watch. However, I was disappointed with the quality of sushi (fish didn't look very fresh) and the number of rolls you get for the price of the plate. The man making sushi was very nice!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
We were planning on going to a different place but they closed early.  It was late and we were hungry and this was one of the few options still open near by.  This place should be avoided at all costs.Sadly, since this place probably lives on tricking tourists into thinking they are getting good and authentic Japanese food they do not care what anyone says.  

The food is awful, the restaurant is dirty,  and the wait staff is rude.  Collectively we ordered honey walnut roll, sashimi salad, shrimp tempura roll, tonkatsu, and udon noodles.  I do not think anyone had anything good to say about anything.  The rice was mushy , the tonkatsu was tough and greasy, the fish was poor quailty, and the soup was bland,  The waitress is rude and not in an endearing way.  The whole place feels grimy and the table was sticky.  I just hope I don't end up getting sick from eating here.
author: Brad L.

description:
Worst place ever! Do not go here! I don't understand why we chose to stay. Our biggest mistake...not checking yelp before walking in. I would give this place zero stars if I could. 

The service was terrible. The sushi looked like it was rotten and the entire place was just dirty.
author: Helen L.

description:
The food was ok but there was TERRIBLE TERRIBLE customer service. Two thumbs down.

My brother and I went in a couple of weeks ago and when we got our check they had included a 15% gratuity on it. It was very hard to communicate with the staff there so my brother and I just  paid and left but I felt that was wrong on their part. We were going to tip her but she basically stole tip from us and made us tip her. I don't like feeling like I am being forced to do anything. 
I don't recommend this place at all.
author: Diana C.

description:
EWWWW.               DOUBLE EWWWWW.             TRIPLE EWWWWW!!!

This has got to be the worst sushi joint on the planet! Overpriced, not fresh sushi - do they take us as fools??

Their sign outside boasts "$1.00" sushi plates! When we get inside, we see that their $1.00 sushi plates are actually cookies... -_____- since when are cookies considered fish?

They have plates labeled with different colors and patterns, and a guide that explains how much each plate costs. Some very plain sushi comes out to $2.50 per bite! That's unheard of!

I HIGHLY recommend you guys to stay away from this place.
author: Grace C.

description: No review to be given it was so poor. Never go here. Bugs, food gross and service terrible.
author: Joan M.

description:
Don't let those cute little sushi boats lure you in. They float low quality sushi rolls around at a premium price.

Little variety, no specialty rolls, and about three times more expensive than you're used to paying.
author: Cole C.

description: 0 stars. Please, please, PLEASEEE stay away from this very terrible establishment. I don't know how people can even leave more than one stars. Terrible, terrible service. One lady running the whole show and was cutting watermelon pieces on a dining table. Didn't see a cutting board. Yuck! Got the super duper roll. It was super duper bad! NOTHING IS 99 CENTS. Rolls were terribly overpriced. Everything on the boat was overpriced. As customer kept walking in, the sushi chef decided to take a break AT THE SUSHI BAR NEXT TO CUSTOMERS EATING NOODLES! There was no sushi chef on duty at a full sushi bar! Please save yourself, they are robbing all the tourists.
author: Brian Y.

description:
This place is full of CR**!!! They don't even deserve one star!!!

Horrible customer service!
RUDE employees with attitude!
They seem to cater to non-Asian customers only!
They post up false advertisements claiming their rolls starts at .99!
They charge gratuity when it's not posted ANYWHERE! The only thing I see is on the menu for party of 6, they'll charge 15%! We were a party of 3 (1st visit) and 4 (recently).
They don't make authentic rolls either. I ordered a 'BAKED' roll and it was almost rare and NOT BAKE AT ALL!!! I've ordered this roll a million times before, it was NOTHING like it. 

NEVER EVER WILL I RECOMMEND THIS PIECE OF SH** PLACE TO ANYONE OR RETURN TO IT!!!
author: A. H.

description:
Come here for the novelty. It's fun to watch the food ride the boats. Wish I could have taken my son. I'm sure he would have been amused.

As for the taste, it was pretty good. Nothing special, but pretty good. Lol. My ex's girl (sushi expert) said they put too much rice on their sushi and not enough fillings. I did enjoy the desserts. I came here during low traffic hours, so I'm sure it tastes much better when it picks up. 

They charge by the plate like the dim sum joint in my town so I couldn't finish it all. The cheapest plates were I think 75 cents (please correct my memory. heheh) and the more expensive ones were around $5. You get 2-4 pieces of food on one plate. So... if you are a sampler like me, just keep your curiosity low or you might not be able to finish it all. Some lucky bum ate the rest of my leftovers. 

Damn I'm craving sushi now. Too bad the sushi in my town does not float on boats! Cause if it did, I'd like to rock tha boat, rock tha boat!

Want to see these mofos in action? 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aBXnrDi8ij4
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDPYMpfUo2A
author: Julie A.

description:
Oh those clever, tricky Chinese people.  Yes, open up a Japanese restaurant in the middle of touristy Grant Street Chinatown, and throw in some water and floating boats.  How else would you get people to pay ridiculously disgusting prices for ridiculously disgusting food?  Sneaky sneaks.

I'm not one to fall for any tourist traps like this, nor do I like floating sushi boat restaurants because the ones I've been to, while decent, were not as fresh as I like my sushi.  However, after a recent bout with food poisoning, all I wanted for lunch was a bowl of udon noodles, and there's nowhere else to get it but Floating Sushi Boat.  These people seriously have a monopoly on Japanese food in the area.

Around 12:45, the restaurant was mostly empty.  I went in, ordered some tempura udon (~$8) and gyoza ($5.95) to go.  While I was there, I realized that the place was run by Chinese people because there was a woman (I'm guessing she's the owner) telling the one single server that she needed to give people menus, take drink orders, and clean up before the customers leave.

I was told to wait about 10 minutes for my food, and I watched the sushi pieces float around.  They didn't look bad, but they didn't look like anything special or good (Fune-Ya is much better, and that's saying a lot).  In addition to the sushi boat, they also have different types of chicken and pork katsu, teriyaki meats, and noodle soups.  The prices are really high for what the stuff is - my lunch cost me $16.35! - but considering it's the only Japanese place around, I was left with no choice.

The gyoza was actually not bad, which warrants maybe a 3-star rating.  The skin was sauteed crispy at the bottom, and it had plenty of flavor (they drizzled the dipping sauce on top), but the inside was packed too densely (which I guess is better than not enough) and therefore was a little too hard and tough.  But 5 pieces of mediocre gyoza for $5.95 is kind of a ripoff.

My tempura udon was a complete and utter disappointment.  Not only was the tempura completely bland, the noodle broth was also lacking in flavor.  It moderately satisfied my craving for udon noodles and warmed me up on a cold afternoon, but I seriously prefer the instant kinds where you just add hot water.
