description: If this is the same place as it was about 10 years ago, then must I just say I remember many complaints with those whom I went with, and I wasn't fond myself either. Sushi is Chinatown cannot be trusted anyway. Or so I'd think.
author: Elaine H.

description:
They have good food cheap not the nicest place.  Not the best service.  I would go again.

Update 

I will never eat there again I saw something gross stuff.  Not enough hand washing for me.
author: America F.

description:
i was disappointed in this specific location (they have another one, i cant remember the location of the other one, i think richmond? that one is better)

i agree with other posters.  they lure you in on the 99 cent special. that place was empty and the waiters were slow. We left before after they gave us the water. what a shame!
author: Marcia R.

description: let me tell you that this is not that place to eat if youre looking for goodservice. the place is almost empty the food is not even good. I GOT A HEADACHE AND FELT AWFUL after eating the nasty food here.  the waitress was so rude. when my boyfriend asked if they had bento boxes like it was pictured on window outside she got mad and started rushing our order.  i will never eat here again.  and when we asked for a extra plate they kind of hesitant to give us one. so dont go here. you wont like it here. for better service just walk down the block and up the hill abit to sushi rock. its alot better there and the service is better.
author: cristina t.

description: The floating sushi boat is a unique place to eat.  If you go do not sit at a table, instead, sit at the counter, and watch the food float by, when you see what you want, pick it up.  Pay close attention to the plates, that is how you are charged.  For example my son ate $16 worth of shrimp in just a few minutes.  All in all a decent place.
author: Chad M.

description: I haven't been here in soo long. I think their sushi is kind of expensive, to rip off the tourist. But I really like the floating sushi bar.
author: Janet Z.

description: Conveniently located right on the main drag through china town (Grant St.) If you come late at night for a beer and some sushi (long after the crowds are gone) there isn't much on the boats and the sushi chef will make you what you want. Still, I'd rather eat elsewhere.
author: Mike I.

description: I didn't eat here - nor will I ever. I had some take-out food (from elsewhere) and I was passing by here when I realized the other place didn't give me any utensils. I stopped in and asked if I could have a plastic fork or a set of those disposable chopsticks. The assholes inside were VERY rude and condescending, like I was trying to steal from them. They were rude as hell even to Chinatown standards, and that REALLY says something about the place.
author: Tony L.

description: this is a negative star... I feel this place is only in business due to location and tourists stumbling in. The place has no customer service, place is dirty and I feel the hostess plays dumb to cheat people out of things. She hardly looked at us when we came in and just said sit wherever. I had to flag her down to order two soda's. The prices aren't that great compared to what you are getting, small portions. The crumbled jello on the floor was just as amusing to look at as the hot dog that kept circling around on the sushi boat. It had this glossy look to it. Not sure what they coated it with but it was worth taking pictures. After eating two california rolls and realizing the order of edamame was never coming (after 20+ minutes) we left. I had to go up to the counter and tell her I was done. As she failed to read the cues that I was done and ready to get out of there. Don't go here, its a waste of time (especially if you are paying for parking). There is better food, friendlier service to be found. These people are meant for a food court or a highschool cafeteria.
author: Heather C.

description: Mediocre.  Service can suck it, you feel forgotten about and have to practically flash someone to get their attention, Tokyo Express down the street is better and the sushi is way more fresh.
author: erica u.

description: Tourist trap! This place was horrid..Avoid..Teryaki chicken tasted like fish and the rest of it was less than mediocre...
author: George D.

description:
wow. so, my friend and i have out little non-tradition of strolling around town and somehow end up in Chinatown and grab some cheap greasy dim sum... which by the way, rocks!

so we wanted to try something different, hmmm, we thought Floating Boat Sushi sounds good.. key word, SOUNDS!

we walk in and have to seat outselves, which wasn't so bad, especially since the place was empty. the waitress came over and handed us only 1 menu, which was ok. she took our drinks and left. 10 minutes later she comes back with our drinks and takes our order... that's when things go down hilll..

first off, she yanks the menu from my friends hand before she's even done ordering and walks away! we weren't even done ordering! the food takes forever to come, and when it does the portions are tiny for their prices! hmmm, i thought, my food taste a little off... could it have been the fake lobster and crab in my sushi? yes, it was imitation! the waitress came back when we were done just to bring us our bill, and can you tell me how 2 rolls and 2 drinks equal $40????

she still had the audacity to circle the "Tip" section on the bill!!! hell nah!!! it was the first time i've left a place without tipping! 

DO NOT GO THERE, food is tasteless, takes a long time to get it and service is HORRIBLE! dim sum, please forgive us for not going to you instead!!!
author: Manny M.

description: This place sucks. It's terrible quality. Terrible service. Terrible sushi. Terribly overpriced. After a few hours walking in Chinatown, I was hungry for a snack. When I wandered in, the sushi boat had nothing good on it, but the waitress told me to ask the sushi chef lady to make me something that i wanted. i wrongly assumed she'd make me 3 pieces on the sushi boat plates. Instead, I get a plate with 6 pieces that were so overladen with mayonnaise that they were inedible. 3.95 for a california roll. 9.95 for the "special" shrimp tempura roll that was really a mayonnaise roll. And, $1.00 for tea. With tax, it was $15.10 for 8 pieces of sushi (1 boat roll, 1 "special" roll. I even asked the woman, "It's $9.95 for this shrimp roll?" She obviously didn't care. Used to ripping people off. Isn't she ashamed to be serving shitty food at ridiculous prices. Anyhow, they need to take their 99c sushi flyers out of the window and replace them with $9.95 flyers. I didn't leave them a tip. And, I don't think I've ever done that before. I'd like to give this place 0 stars. Avoid this place if you're walking around in Chinatown and get hungry. Don't make the mistake that I did. Blech.
author: Maren P.

description:
this place offers the perfect example on what NOT to do if you want a successful business.....

we used to go there regularly a few years ago. but the place has obviously gone downhill in terms of food and service quality. Most of the dishes on the float have been circulating for quite a while. Very little choices on sushi....there are way too many crappy chinese dim sum. our theory is that some of the stuff went to dim sum in the morning and packed some left-overs and served them in the restaurant....

sushi: little choice, not fresh and not cheap.
service: terrible. we went in around 7pm Sat nite. the staff were eating dinner!! no one was there to serve us. we sat there for 40min, no one ever added a new sushi dish.  we ended up ordering a Udon which wasn't good at all.
author: Kitty L.

description:
they have baklava and carrot cake on the boats.

like dropping acid - not in a good  way.

how is this place still open.
author: Greg g.

description: if i could give a place no stars, this would be it. it's a sad excuse for a restaurant. all i remember about the food was that it was bland, looked a little suspiciously not-so-fresh and the service was superbly torturous (yep, it's the kind where I was close to just going to the bussing station to go get some water) - especially since we were the only ones there that night. i think they should rename it floating sushi poop.
author: ray e.

description: (Holy ****). Hadn't ate all day and was really hungry. Got suckered in by the  name; "Floating Sushi", "looked good when I saw that on tv once" (Of course in hindsight, "this wasnt Japan"). Stumbled in and immediately knew we screwed up. "why didn't we just find some good dim-sum. Everything everyone said about the awful waitresses and bad, old food is true. Ordered some beef udon, completely unedible. Yuck.  Left completely pissed. They knew we were mad and didn't like the food and they could of cared less. "$45 for three and all left hungry and cheated. Well, shoulda' checked yelp first.
author: Ed M.

description: Its a gimmick.  There are better sushi places to go but this is solid stuff.  Make sure you don't grab the stuff off the boat that's been going around for too long.  Looks like I had a better experience with my server than a lot of other folks.  Its okay stuff.
author: Branden E.

description: Terrible, awful place. Everyone in the restaurant had to BEG to get anyone's attention, be it the waitress or the sushi chef. Good luck getting a miso soup, tea refill, or even a FORK if you're sitting in front of the boats. On top of the horrible service, the meal was $80 for myself and two others! NO booze, just food. Go somewhere else, even if you're starving. I didn't leave a tip for the first time in my life.
author: Amanda C.
